original: Yuka, have you decided how you're going to spend your summer vacation?
slashSplit: Yuka, / have you decided how you're going to spend your summer vacation?
parenSplit: Yuka, have you decided how you're going to spend your summer vacation?
vocabularySplit: + Yuka / , / + have / + you / + decided / + how / + you're / + going / + to / + spend / + your / + summer / + vacation / ?

original: Not yet, Sam.
slashSplit: Not yet, / Sam.
parenSplit: Not yet, Sam.
vocabularySplit: + Not / + yet / , / + Sam / .

original: I'm planning to travel abroad.
slashSplit: I'm planning / to travel abroad.
parenSplit: I'm planning to travel abroad.
vocabularySplit: + I'm / + planning / + to / + travel / + abroad / .

original: I want to go to Paris or Rome, but I can't decide which city to choose.
slashSplit: I want to go / to Paris / or Rome, / but I can't decide which city / to choose.
parenSplit: I want to go <to Paris> or Rome, but I can't decide which city to choose.
vocabularySplit: + I / + want to / + go / + to Paris / + or / + Rome / , / + but / + I / + can't / + decide / + which / + city / + to choose / .

original: Both cities are great to visit.
slashSplit: Both cities are great / to visit.
parenSplit: Both cities are great to visit.
vocabularySplit: + Both / + cities / + are / + great / + to visit / .

original: Will it be your first trip to Europe?
slashSplit: Will it be your first trip / to Europe?
parenSplit: Will it be your first trip <to Europe>?
vocabularySplit: + Will / + it / + be / + your / + first / + trip / + to Europe / ?

original: Yes, I've visited Australia before, but I've never traveled to Europe.
slashSplit: Yes, / I've visited Australia before, / but I've never traveled / to Europe.
parenSplit: Yes, I've visited Australia before, but I've never traveled <to Europe>.
vocabularySplit: + Yes / , / + I've / + visited / + Australia / + before / , / + but / + I've / + never / + traveled / + to Europe / .

original: Traveling to Europe is expensive.
slashSplit: Traveling / to Europe / is expensive.
parenSplit: Traveling <to Europe> is expensive.
vocabularySplit: + Traveling / + to / + Europe / + is / + expensive / .

original: But this summer, I will go there.
slashSplit: But this summer, / I will go there.
parenSplit: But this summer, I will go there.
vocabularySplit: + But / + this / + summer / , / + I / + will / + go / + there / .

original: I see.
slashSplit: I see.
parenSplit: I see.
vocabularySplit: + I / + see / .

original: What do you want to do during your trip?
slashSplit: What do you want to do / during your trip?
parenSplit: What do you want to do <during your trip>?
vocabularySplit: + What / + do / + you / + want to / + do / + during your trip / ?

original: Well...
slashSplit: Well...
parenSplit: Well...

original: I'm interested in history, so I want to visit some historical sites.
slashSplit: I'm interested / in history, / so I want to visit some historical sites.
parenSplit: I'm interested in history, so I want to visit some historical sites.
vocabularySplit: + I'm / + interested / + in history / , / + so / + I / + want to / + visit / + some / + historical / + sites / .

original: I want to try local foods, too.
slashSplit: I want to try local foods, / too.
parenSplit: I want to try local foods, too.
vocabularySplit: + I / + want to / + try / + local / + foods / , / + too / .

original: Are you staying for about two weeks?
slashSplit: Are you staying / for about two weeks?
parenSplit: Are you staying <for about two> weeks?
vocabularySplit: + Are / + you / + staying / + for about two weeks / ?

original: No, for one week.
slashSplit: No, / for one week.
parenSplit: No, <for one week>.
vocabularySplit: + No / , / + for one week / .

original: I wish I could visit the two cities during my trip.
slashSplit: I wish I could visit the two cities / during my trip.
parenSplit: I wish I could visit the two cities <during my trip>.
vocabularySplit: + I / + wish / + I / + could / + visit / + the / + two / + cities / + during my trip / .

original: It may be possible, Yuka.
slashSplit: It may be possible, / Yuka.
parenSplit: It may be possible, Yuka.
vocabularySplit: + It / + may / + be / + possible / , / + Yuka / .

original: I just checked the Internet and found a plan.
slashSplit: I just checked the Internet / and found a plan.
parenSplit: I just checked the Internet and found a plan.
vocabularySplit: + I / + just / + checked / + the / + Internet / + and / + found / + a / + plan / .

original: In this plan, you can visit both cities.
slashSplit: In this plan, / you can visit both cities.
parenSplit: <In this plan>, you can visit both cities.
vocabularySplit: + In this plan / , / + you / + can / + visit / + both / + cities / .

original: Look.
slashSplit: Look.
parenSplit: Look.
vocabularySplit: + Look / .

original: That sounds great.
slashSplit: That sounds great.
parenSplit: (That sounds great).
vocabularySplit: + That / + sounds / + great / .

original: The travel fee is just 10,000 yen higher than my original plan.
slashSplit: The travel fee is just 10,000 yen higher than my original plan.
parenSplit: The travel fee is just 10,000 yen higher than my original plan.
vocabularySplit: + The / + travel / + fee / + is / + just / + 10 / , / + 000 / + yen / + higher / + than my original plan / .

original: If I make my travel plan longer, I can enjoy traveling in the two cities.
slashSplit: If I make my travel plan longer, I can enjoy traveling / in the two cities.
parenSplit: (If I make my travel plan longer), I can enjoy traveling <in the two> cities>.
vocabularySplit: + If / + I / + make / + my / + travel / + plan / + longer / , / + I / + can / + enjoy / + traveling / + in the two cities / .
